references.paper_title: The complexities of grasping in the wild
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the challenges in robotic grasping, directly relevant to the complex manipulation tasks tackled in the current research.

references.paper_title: A system for general in-hand object re-orientation
references.reason: This paper presents a method for in-hand object re-orientation, a key task related to the dynamic in-hand manipulation addressed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Surprisingly robust in-hand manipulation: An empirical study
references.reason: This study focuses on in-hand manipulation using soft robots, directly comparing to the methods and challenges of the current study.

references.paper_title: Dynamic manipulation like normal-type pen spinning by a high-speed robot hand and a high-speed vision system
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the task of pen spinning using a high-speed robot hand, providing a direct comparison to the present work's approach.
This paper utilizes reinforcement learning to accomplish the pen spinning task, offering an alternative approach for comparison with the method presented in the current research.
